intro: Microstylis furcata, commonly known as the forked microstylis, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family, and is characterized by its delicate, intricate floral structures. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters along the stem. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often growing in dense clusters near the base of the plant. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Microstylis furcata is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
